attributes.action: Replace teacher assessments with course work for GCSEs and A levels
attributes.additional_details: As students education has been affected and disrupted by coronavirus, the government had no choice but to cancel exams and use “teacher assessments.” Teacher assessments will most probably rely on mocks/exams. This will not be fairest way to judge the students performance as students have missed out on six months of their learning.
attributes.background: Many students relied on exams as the government assured us that we would take our GCSEs and A levels this year. Course work will allow teachers and exam boards to have a clear picture of a students academic ability.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want students to be judged on coursework, but this would still need to be assessed by a teacher to provide students with a grade.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Grade GCSEs and A-levels on coursework, with no exams, from 2021 onwards: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562814
